001package imagingbook.common.math;
002
003import java.util.Random;
004
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
007
008public class RandomMatrixGenerator {
009        
010        private final Random rg;
011        
012        public RandomMatrixGenerator(long seed) {
013                this.rg = new Random(seed);
014        }
015        
016        public RandomMatrixGenerator() {
017                this.rg = new Random();
018        }
019        
020        public RandomMatrixGenerator(Random rg) {
021                this.rg = rg;
022        }
023        
024        public double[][] makeRandomMatrix(int rows, int cols, double s) {
025                double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
026                for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
027                        for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {
028                                double x = s * 2 * (rg.nextDouble() - 0.5);
029                                A[i][j] = x;
030                        }
031                }
032                return A;
033        }
034        
035        public double[][] makeRandomMatrix(int rows, int cols) {
036                return makeRandomMatrix(rows, cols, 1.0);
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Creates and returns a square matrix of size n x n with
041         * random values in [-s, s].
042         * @param n the matrix size
043         * @param s the value scale
044         * @return a random matrix
045         */
046        public double[][] makeRandomSquareMatrix(int n, double s) {
047                double[][] A = new double[n][n];
048                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
049                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
050                                double x = s * 2 * (rg.nextDouble() - 0.5);
051                                A[i][j] = x;
052                        }
053                }
054                return A;
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Creates and returns a square matrix of size n x n with
059         * random values in [-1, 1].
060         * @param n the matrix size
061         * @return a random matrix
062         */
063        public double[][] makeRandomSquareMatrix(int n) {
064                return makeRandomSquareMatrix(n, 1.0);
065        }
066        
067        /**
068         * Creates and returns a square symmetric matrix of size n x n with
069         * random values in [-s, s].
070         * @param n the matrix size
071         * @param s the value scale
072         * @return a random matrix
073         */
074        public double[][] makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(int n, double s) {
075                double[][] A = new double[n][n];
076                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
077                        for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
078                                double x = s * 2 * (rg.nextDouble() - 0.5);
079                                A[i][j] = x;
080                                if (i != j) {
081                                        A[j][i] = x;
082                                }
083                        }
084                }
085                return A;
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Creates and returns a square matrix symmetric of size n x n with
090         * random values in [-1, 1].
091         * @param n the matrix size
092         * @return a random matrix
093         */
094        public double[][] makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(int n) {
095                return makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(n, 1.0);
096        }
097        
098        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
099        
100        public static void main(String[] args) {
101                RandomMatrixGenerator rg = new RandomMatrixGenerator(17);
102//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(rg.makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(3));
103                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(rg.makeRandomMatrix(3 , 5,  1));
104                System.out.println("M = \n" + Matrix.toString(M));
105                System.out.println("M symmetric = " + MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(M, 1e-6));
106                
107                
108                
109                
110                RealMatrix Z = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
111                                {{-640324.756071648600000, -13455.063269205853000, -271133.849253710070000, -22199.258754168728000}, 
112                        {-13455.063269205852000, 565371.765546445600000, -16613.193426604714000, 58.180548072531145}, 
113                        {-271133.849253710070000, -16613.193426604714000, 74939.976000059920000, 1080.126330774859300}, 
114                        {-22199.258754168724000, 58.180548072531160, 1080.126330774859000, 13.014525143606523}}
115                );
116                
117                System.out.println("Z symmetric = " + Matrix.isSymmetric(Z, 1e-12));
118                
119        }
120
121}
